_header: Right noble lord and prelate dear
Bibliographic Ghosts: Philadelphia, University of Pennsylvania Library Codex 111 [formerly Smith 4], ff. 1-10: this is a prose treatise.
_description: Wylliam Bolosse, ‘The Marrow or Pithe of Alkymy’, an alchemical tract — nineteen stanzas rhyme royal

BodAsh1479.First Lines:
Ryght noble lorde & prelat dearewouchesafe of me thes versys
                    take…
BodAsh1479.Last Lines:
…& in syche force thy worke displayeas sownde maye to thy
                    laude all waye
BodAsh1479.Attributed Author:
Here after folowythe thes versys in ynglysshe & put in mytter by
                    William Bolosse (f. *32)

BodRawB306.First Lines:
Right noble Lord & prelate dearevoutch safe of me thes verses
                    take…
BodRawB306.Last Lines:
…And in such sorte this worke displayeAs sownd may to this
                    Lourde all waye
BodRawB306.Editions:
Ashmole,  Elias. 
             Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum.
         London: J. Grimond, 1652: 389-92 (mistaken for the Prologue of Ripley’s
                            Medulla).

CamTCC1137.First Lines:
Right noble lord and prelate deareVouchsafe of me these versis
                    take…
CamTCC1137.Last Lines:
…and in such sort the worcke displayas sounde to thy laude
                    alway
CamTCC1137.Attributed Title: The marrow or pithe of Alkymye (f. 1)
